RE: License #: CB330361250
Lutheran Adoption Service
1545 Keystone
Lansing, MI 48911
Dear Ms. Sykes:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/09/2021. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and MISEP requirements. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. One CAP was approved on 12/28/20 as a
result of an investigation on 10/5/20. The investigation determined a violation of
contract/policy item AAM 200: Subsidy. A second CAP was approved on 12/28/20
as a result of an investigation on 10/16/20. The investigation determined a violation
of rule 206 regarding staff qualifications. At this time, both CAPs have been
implemented and there appear to be no further concerns in these areas.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment was reviewed. The 2020 DCWL
renewal evaluation had no violations cited. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported
the agency continues to run smoothly despite the impact of COVID-19 this year.
Staff have transitioned from working remotely to working a hybrid schedule, and all
Communication Issuances and directions from Children’s Services Administration
have been followed to maintain safety for staff and clients. The CA indicated there
have been some challenges with timeliness of fingerprinting and court hearings
being delayed. However, there has been some improvement as COVID restrictions
lift. Overall, the agency continues to work on standardizing work among all LAS
offices to ensure consistency and compliance.
4

Interviews
One adoption worker was interviewed. The worker reported being with the agency
for several years. The worker stated she enjoyed her job and did not have any
concerns with the agency. The worker reported feeling safe and supported in her
position and did not express any areas in which the agency could improve.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Field analysts are not visiting adoptive homes at this time.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, and contract/policy. It is recommended that
the facility continue on a regular license.
___ _________ November 10, 2021_____
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 10, 2021

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
